props.name: caption
props.docs: The title for the table only visible to screen readers.

props.name: columns
props.docs: The column headers for the table.

props.name: data
props.docs: The row content for the table.

props.name: density
props.docs: Set the density of the table including font and padding.

props.name: embedded
props.docs: Applies a border to the table container.

props.name: hideColumnHeaders
props.docs: If `true`, column headers will not be visible.

props.name: paginationOptions
props.type: { itemsPerPage?: { label: string; value: string; }[]; type?: IcPaginationTypes; control?: IcPaginationControlTypes; itemsPerPageControl?: boolean; goToPageControl?: boolean; alignment?: IcPaginationAlignmentOptions; }

complexType.resolved: { itemsPerPage?: { label: string; value: string; }[]; type?: IcPaginationTypes; control?: IcPaginationControlTypes; itemsPerPageControl?: boolean; goToPageControl?: boolean; alignment?: IcPaginationAlignmentOptions; }

props.docs: Sets the props for the pagination bar.
props.default:
{
    itemsPerPage: [
      { label: "10", value: "10" },
      { label: "25", value: "25" },
      { label: "50", value: "50" },
    ],
    type: "page",
    control: "simple",
    itemsPerPageControl: true,
    goToPageControl: true,

values.type: { itemsPerPage?: { label: string; value: string; }[]; type?: IcPaginationTypes; control?: IcPaginationControlTypes; itemsPerPageControl?: boolean; goToPageControl?: boolean; alignment?: IcPaginationAlignmentOptions; }

props.name: showPagination
props.docs: If `true`, adds a pagination bar to the bottom of the table.

props.name: sortOptions
props.docs: Sets the order columns will be sorted in and allows for 'default' sorts to be added.

props.name: sortable
props.docs: If `true`, allows table columns to be sorted using applied sort buttons.

props.name: stickyColumnHeaders
props.docs: If `true`, column headers will remain at the top of the table when scrolling vertically.

props.name: stickyRowHeaders
props.docs: If `true`, row headers will remain to the left when scrolling horizontally.

props.name: dateFormat
props.docs: The format in which the date will be displayed.

props.name: disableDays
props.docs: The days of the week to disable.

props.name: disableDaysMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disableDays` is set and a disabled date is entered.
props.default: "The date you have selected is on a day of the week that is not allowed. Please select another date."

props.name: disableFuture
props.docs: If `true`, dates in the future are not allowed. A validation message will appear if a date in the future is entered.

props.name: disableFutureMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disableFuture` is true and a date in the future is entered.
props.default: "Dates in the future are not allowed. Please select a date in the past."

props.name: disablePast
props.docs: If `true`, dates in the past are not allowed. A validation message will appear if a date in the past is entered.

props.name: disablePastMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disablePast` is true and a date in the past is entered.
props.default: "Dates in the past are not allowed. Please select a date in the future."

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the disabled state will be set.

props.name: helperText
props.docs: The helper text that will be displayed for additional field guidance. This will default to the text "Use format" along with the `dateFormat` value.

props.name: inputId
props.docs: The ID for the input.

props.name: label
props.docs: The label for the date input.

props.name: max
props.docs:
The latest date that will be allowed. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.
The value of this prop is ignored if `disableFuture` is set to `true`.

props.name: min
props.docs:
The earliest date that will be allowed. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.
The value of this prop is ignored if `disablePast` is set to `true`.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the input will require a value.

props.name: showClearButton
props.docs: If `true`, a button which clears the date input when clicked will be displayed.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the date input to be displayed.

props.name: validationStatus
props.docs: The validation status - e.g. 'error' | 'warning' | 'success'. This will override the built-in date validation.

props.name: validationText
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message. This will override the built-in date validation.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the date input. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.

methods.name: getDate
methods.docs: Returns the value as a Date object

events.docs: Emitted when the input loses focus.
Emitted when the value has changed.
Emitted when the input gains focus.

props.name: dateFormat
props.docs: The format in which the date will be displayed.

props.name: disableDays
props.docs: The days of the week to disable.

props.name: disableDaysMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disableDays` is `true` and a disabled date is entered.
props.default: "The date you have selected is on a day of the week that is not allowed. Please select another date."

props.name: disableFuture
props.docs: If `true`, dates in the future are not allowed. A validation message will appear if a date in the future is entered.

props.name: disableFutureMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disableFuture` is `true` and a date in the future is entered.
props.default: "Dates in the future are not allowed. Please select a date in the past."

props.name: disablePast
props.docs: If `true`, dates in the past are not allowed. A validation message will appear if a date in the past is entered.

props.name: disablePastMessage
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message when `disablePast` is `true` and a date in the past is entered.
props.default: "Dates in the past are not allowed. Please select a date in the future."

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the disabled state will be set.

props.name: helperText
props.docs: The helper text that will be displayed for additional field guidance. This will default to the text "Use format" along with the `dateFormat` value.

props.name: inputId
props.docs: The ID for the input field. The default will be an automatically generated value.

props.name: label
props.docs: The label for the date input.

props.name: max
props.docs:
The latest date that will be allowed. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.
The value of this prop is ignored if `disableFuture` is set to `true`.

props.name: min
props.docs:
The earliest date that will be allowed. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.
The value of this prop is ignored if `disablePast` is set to `true`.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: openAtDate
props.docs:
The date visible when the calendar opens. Used if no date is currently selected.
The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the input will require a value.

props.name: showDaysOutsideMonth
props.docs: If `true`, days outside the current month will be visible in the date picker.

props.name: showPickerClearButton
props.docs: If `true`, the `Clear` button on the date picker will be visible.

props.name: showPickerTodayButton
props.docs: If `true`, the `Go to today` button on the date picker will be visible.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the date picker to be displayed.

props.name: startOfWeek
props.type: IcWeekDays.Friday | IcWeekDays.Monday | IcWeekDays.Saturday | IcWeekDays.Sunday | IcWeekDays.Thursday | IcWeekDays.Tuesday | IcWeekDays.Wednesday

complexType.resolved: IcWeekDays.Friday | IcWeekDays.Monday | IcWeekDays.Saturday | IcWeekDays.Sunday | IcWeekDays.Thursday | IcWeekDays.Tuesday | IcWeekDays.Wednesday

props.docs:
The first day of the week. `0` for Sunday, `1` for Monday, etc.
Default is Monday.

props.name: validationStatus
props.docs: The validation status - e.g. 'error' | 'warning' | 'success'. This will override the built-in date validation.

props.name: validationText
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message. This will override the built-in date validation.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the date picker. The value can be in any format supported as `dateFormat`, in ISO 8601 date string format (`yyyy-mm-dd`) or as a JavaScript `Date` object.

events.docs: Emitted when the value has changed.

props.name: activationType
props.docs: Determines whether options manually set as values (by pressing 'Enter') when they receive focus using keyboard navigation.

props.name: anchorEl
props.docs: The reference to an anchor element the menu will position itself from when rendered.

props.name: closeOnSelect
props.docs: If `true`, the menu will close when an option is selected.

props.name: fullWidth
props.docs: If `true`, the menu will fill the width of the container.

props.name: inputEl
props.docs: The reference to the input element.

props.name: inputLabel
props.docs: The label for the input element.

props.name: labelField
props.docs: The custom name for the label field for IcMenuOption.

props.name: menuId
props.docs: The ID of the menu.

props.name: open
props.docs: If `true`, the menu will be displayed open.

props.name: options
props.docs: The possible menu selection options.

props.name: searchMode
props.docs: Specify the mode search bar uses to search. `navigation` allows for quick lookups of a set of values, `query` allows for more general searches.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the menu.

props.name: small

docsTags.name: deprecated
docsTags.text: This prop should not be used anymore. Set prop `size` to "small" instead.

props.deprecation: This prop should not be used anymore. Set prop `size` to "small" instead.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the currently selected option - or array of values (if multiple options allowed).

props.name: valueField
props.docs: The custom name for the value field for IcMenuOption.

methods.name: handleKeyboardOpen
methods.docs:
Used alongside activationType
If menu is opened via keyboard navigation (i.e. Enter, ArrowUp or ArrowDown), emit optionSelect custom event.

props.name: alignment
props.docs: Sets the alignment of the items in the pagination bar.

props.name: appearance
props.docs: Sets the styling for the items in the pagination bar.

props.name: itemLabel
props.docs: The label which will be used in place of 'items' if paginationType is data. Should be capitalised.

props.name: itemsPerPageOptions
props.docs: The options which will be displayed for 'items per page' select input. Set a maximum of 4 options including a required 'All' option with value equal to total number of items.

props.name: pageLabel
props.docs: The label which will be used in place of 'Page' if paginationType is page. Should be capitalised.

props.name: paginationControl
props.docs: Whether the displayed pagination is simple or complex.

props.name: paginationType
props.docs: Whether total number of items and current item range or total number of pages and current page is displayed.

props.name: showGoToPageControl
props.docs: If `true`, the 'go to page' control should be displayed.

props.name: showItemsPerPage
props.docs: If `true`, the number of total items and current item range or number of total pages and current page should be displayed.

props.name: showItemsPerPageControl
props.docs: If `true`, the select input to control 'items per page' should be displayed.

props.name: totalItems
props.docs: Total number of items to be displayed across all pages.

events.docs: Emitted when the items per page option is changed.
Emitted when a page is navigated to via the 'go to' input.

props.name: charactersUntilSuggestions
props.docs: **[DEPRECATED]** This prop should not be used anymore.

props.name: debounce
props.docs: The amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `icChange` event after each keystroke.

props.name: disableFilter
props.docs: If `true`, the built in filtering will be disabled for a searchable variant. For example, if options will already be filtered from external source.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the disabled state will be set.

props.name: emptyOptionListText
props.docs: The text displayed when there are no options in the option list.

props.name: form
props.docs: The <form> element to associate the select with.

props.name: formaction
props.docs:
The URL that processes the information submitted by the select. It overrides the action attribute of the select's form owner. Does nothing if there is no form owner.
This prop should only be used with searchable select and will only be applied if searchable is true.

props.name: formenctype
props.docs: The way the submitted form data is encoded. This prop should only be used with searchable select and will only be applied if searchable is true.

props.name: formmethod
props.docs: The HTTP method used to submit the form. This prop should only be used with searchable select and will only be applied if searchable is true.

props.name: formnovalidate
props.docs: If `true`, the form will not be validated when submitted. This prop should only be used with searchable select and will only be applied if searchable is true.

props.name: formtarget
props.docs:
The place to display the response from submitting the form. It overrides the target attribute of the select's form owner.
This prop should only be used with searchable select and will only be applied if searchable is true.

props.name: fullWidth
props.docs: If `true`, the select element will fill the width of the container. This prop should only be used with searchable select and will only be applied if searchable is true.

props.name: helperText
props.docs: The helper text that will be displayed for additional field guidance.

props.name: hideLabel
props.docs: If `true`, the label will be hidden and the required label value will be applied as an aria-label.

props.name: includeDescriptionsInSearch
props.docs: If `true`, descriptions of options will be included when filtering options in a searchable select. Only applies to built in filtering.

props.name: includeGroupTitlesInSearch
props.docs: If `true`, group titles of grouped options will be included when filtering options in a searchable select. Only applies to built in filtering.

props.name: label
props.docs: The label for the select.

props.name: loading
props.docs: If `true`, the loading state will be triggered when fetching options asynchronously.

props.name: loadingErrorLabel
props.docs: The message displayed when external loading times out.

props.name: loadingLabel
props.docs: The message displayed whilst the options are being loaded externally.

props.name: multiple
props.docs: If `true`, multiple options can be selected.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: options
props.docs: The possible selection options.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: The placeholder value to be displayed.

props.name: readonly
props.docs: If `true`, the readonly state will be set.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the select will require a value.

props.name: searchMatchPosition
props.docs: Whether the search string of the searchable select should match the start of or anywhere in the options. Only applies to built in filtering.

props.name: searchable
props.docs: If `true`, a searchable variant of the select will be displayed which can be typed in to filter options.

props.name: selectOnEnter
props.docs: If `true`, the icOptionSelect event will be fired on enter instead of ArrowUp and ArrowDown.

props.name: showClearButton
props.docs: If `true`, a button which clears the select input when clicked will be displayed. The button will always appear on the searchable select.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the select.

props.name: small
props.docs: **[DEPRECATED]** This prop should not be used anymore. Set prop `size` to "small" instead.

props.name: timeout
props.docs: If using external filtering, set a timeout for when loading takes too long.

props.name: validationStatus
props.docs: The validation status - e.g. 'error' | 'warning' | 'success'.

props.name: validationText
props.docs: The text to display as the validation message.

props.name: value
props.docs:
The value of the select, reflected by the value of the currently selected option.
For the searchable variant, the value is also reflected by the user input.
For the multi-select variant, the value must be an array of option values.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.docs: Sets focus on the input box.

events.docs: Emitted when the select loses focus.
Emitted when the clear button is clicked.
Emitted when the select gains focus.
Emitted when a keyboard input occurred.
Emitted when `multiple` is `true` and an option is deselected.

Emitted when an option is selected.
Selecting an option will also trigger an `icChange/onIcChange` due to the value being updated.
Emitted when the 'retry loading' button is clicked for a searchable variant.

src/utils/types.ts::IcWeekDays.declaration:
export enum IcWeekDays {
  Sunday = 0,
  Monday = 1,
  Tuesday = 2,
  Wednesday = 3,
  Thursday = 4,
  Friday = 5,
  Saturday = 6,
}
